entries.title: Spotify raised its prices for the second time this year as the music-streaming service aims to become more consistently profitable, sending shares higher.
entries.description: Spotify raised its prices for the second time this year as the music-streaming service aims to become more consistently profitable, sending shares higher.

entries.title: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers surged after some reported record sales in May, spurring hopes that more price cuts are imminent as companies race to grow market share.
entries.description: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers surged after some reported record sales in May, spurring hopes that more price cuts are imminent as companies race to grow market share.

entries.title: Maersk again raised its full-year guidance as disruptions in the Red Sea and strong shipping demand continue to buoy global freight rates.
entries.description: Maersk again raised its full-year guidance as disruptions in the Red Sea and strong shipping demand continue to buoy global freight rates.

entries.title: Medical-technology company Becton Dickinson agreed to acquire Edwards Lifesciences' Critical Care product group for $4.2 billion, increasing its access to hospital customers.
entries.description: Medical-technology company Becton Dickinson agreed to acquire Edwards Lifesciences’ Critical Care product group for $4.2 billion, increasing its access to hospital customers.

entries.title: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 eking out a 0.1% gain to start the month. The Nasdaq rose 0.6% and the Dow declined 0.3%.
entries.description: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 eking out a 0.1% gain to start the month. The Nasdaq rose 0.6% and the Dow declined 0.3%.

entries.title: Macquarie Group's asset-management arm backed renewable-energy company Sol Systems with an $85 million debt investment.
entries.description: Macquarie Group’s asset-management arm backed renewable-energy company Sol Systems with an $85 million debt investment.

entries.title: E*Trade considered barring meme-stock leader Keith Gill from its platform after growing concerned about potential stock manipulation around his recent purchases of GameStop options, according to people familiar with the matter.
entries.description: E*Trade considered barring meme-stock leader Keith Gill from its platform after growing concerned about potential stock manipulation around his recent purchases of GameStop options, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Biden's Cease-Fire Plan Seeks to Push Hamas and Israel Into an Agreement Neither Wants
entries.description: The U.S. president is more interested in a deal than the two warring parties are.

entries.title: Big Tech Companies Unplug Stock Market From Reality
entries.description: The big-vs.-small-stocks phenomenon reflects the same disconnects we see in the broader economy.

entries.title: India's Narendra Modi Projected to Win Historic Third Term
entries.description: Exit polls predict he will become only the second leader in India’s history to win three straight terms.

entries.title: Why China's Overcapacity Problem Is About to Get Even Worse, in Seven Charts
entries.description: Cheap Chinese high-tech goods have flooded the global economy this year, raising alarms in Washington and Brussels.

entries.title: Yuan Likely to Weaken Modestly, Gradually by End-2024, HSBC Says
entries.description: The Chinese yuan is likely to weaken modestly and gradually by end-2024, HSBC said.

entries.title: Hong Kong Shares Edge Higher as Investors Weigh PMI Data
entries.description: Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index rose 0.1% to 18422.20, erasing early losses.

entries.title: Oil Falls as OPEC Plans Fuel Supply Concerns
entries.description: Oil fell in early Asian trade amid supply concerns. These come after OPEC laid out plans over the weekend to remove some voluntary cuts earlier than expected, the ANZ Research team said.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: It began with a LinkedIn message—she seemed polite and attractive. It turned into a nightmare that cost him everything.

entries.title: The Goal forChina's Chip Giant: Cut Out the U.S.
entries.description: Hit by Washington’s export controls, China’s domestic chip industry strives for self-sufficiency.

entries.title: America's Commute to Work Is Getting Longer and Longer
entries.description: Drives to the office that take over an hour are becoming more common—and even more palatable.

entries.title: Merrick Garland, Three Special Counsels and a Justice Department Under Fire
entries.description: The attorney general has tried to stay above the political fray while overseeing investigations into Trump, Biden and his son.

entries.title: JGB 10-Year Yield May Test Upside Between Now and BOJ's Meeting Next Week
entries.description: The 10-year JGB yield may test upside between now and the Bank of Japan’s meeting on June 13-14 amid concerns over early additional rate increases or worry that the BOJ may reduce bond purchases, Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley Securities said.
